text: Probably the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire existence. So disappointing. So unnecessary. So ridiculous. Waste of time. Even one star is too much for it.

This movie was great. I honestly have no idea how anyone thought this movie was bad. This is a perfect love letter to old slasher films in all of its cheesy glory. From the intentionally old cameras for the 80s feel the outfits and music. Its all from that time period it even has this classic dark synthwave music for the intense parts. I throughly enjoyed this movie way more than the original fear streets since those were like a glorified goosebumps story with monsters coming to life in a scooby doo sense. This movie while predictable would have had so much higher ratings if 1. It wasnt tied to the original fear street brand. 2. If it had encapsulated the genre comedy as that one guy says wowzers as his arm was getting cut off it made me laugh  3. If it released in the 80s when cliches were more norm and not considered overdone. Even if they were overdone cliches its more the execution of the story and the execution here is spectacular. Or 4. Seen as a loveletter to this time period of movies.
It even continues past the point where you expect it to be over in true classic horror fashion.

Too many people are mad about this film. Is it great? No. Is it acceptable? Absolutely. The story isn't tied to the previous trilogy, but to be fair, it never purported to be. The formula is familiar, so don't expect a lot of surprises, but the reveal certainly isn't the worst I've seen in slasher films.
Adriana Greenblatt is in it so yea 1 star, btw cause she is good not bad
6/10. 68/100. | W/ Dad for Halloween.
I don’t know the hate to this movie is is good.

Based on the 1992 novel The Prom Queen from R. L. Stine’s Fear Street series, this slasher serves as the fourth installment in the Fear Street film franchise. Set in 1988, it follows a masked killer who begins targeting the prom queen candidates of Shadyside High on the night of their senior dance.

Sadly, this entry feels like a major step down from the original trilogy. It fails to capture the mystery, tension, and emotional depth that made those films stand out. The characters are thinly written and difficult to care about, while the performances feel forced and unnatural, with clunky dialogue that drains any suspense. The story sticks so rigidly to familiar slasher clichés that every twist can be seen coming from miles away. While the retro 80s soundtrack is acceptable, it is not enough to make the film memorable. The kills are gruesome, too obvious, and unimaginatively executed, lacking the creative flair that defined the previous films.
This movie is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen

One of the WORST movies I’ve ever seen in my life! Completely predictable, lost the thrill and the comedy behind the first 3 Fear Street movies on Netflix. A terrible plot line, no character development whatsoever, barely any comedy, terrible acting, and terrible storyline overall. This really feels like Netflix just wanted to make a buck and turn a movie around quickly. Also, Ariana Greenblatt was one of the most famous actresses in that entire sad movie and her character had 0 role through it all. A missed opportunity. 

I am serious when I say I don’t know if I’ve seen a WORSE movie…. Not worth your time. So bad that I would consider cancelling my Netflix subscription. They had such an opportunity to continue a hot streak from some decent / good movies with the first 3 Fear Streets that had better storylines, were funny, and entertaining. But dang, you guys missed the mark.

I also think this is the first movie review I’ve ever written. And I’m just writing this because that was without a doubt probably the WORST movie I’ve ever seen in my life. Terrible, awful. Do not waste your time.

As mortes... Tem 12 mortes no filme. Dentro dessas, pra mim, o filme só acerta em 5. A morte do Bobby (namorado da Linda), a morte da Melissa (talvez a única personagem que eu me importo, junto com a Megan Rogers, a melhor amiga de Lori), a morte do Tyler (interesse amoroso de Lori, a protagonista), e... Errei as contas. O filme só acerta nessas 3 mortes. A trilha sonora é perfeita, eu fiquei dançando durante as músicas, pena que é um filme fraco, nem a trilha salva. Os personagens não têm desenvolvimento. O filme parece mais Pânico (só que péssimo), do que Rua do Medo. O meu objetivo em Rua do Medo NÃO É adivinhar os assassinos, mas sim admirar as mortes, tentar entender as conexões com Sarah Fier e os assassinos possuídos, coisa que eu não consigo nesse filme, já que não tem NENHUMA conexão com a trilogia original além de apenas DUAS MENÇÕES ao Acampamento Nightwing completamente CURTAS e esquecíveis. Os assassinos são FRAQUÍSSIMOS. Eu quero adivinhar quem são os assassinos na franquia PÂNICO, e não na franquia Rua do Medo. Não me divirto, acho muito chato. É um filme com mortes feitas com CGI horrível, sendo que em filmes mais antigos, como em Pânico, de 1996, a morte da Casey é INCRÍVEL! E FOI FEITA COM EFEITO PRÁTICO. Tem uma morte IDÊNTICA a essa em Rainha do Baile, mas é HORRÍVEL. O CGI é TOSCO, é uma droga. Durante as mortes, os personagens que morrem (tirando uma ou duas mortes fora de tela, Melissa, Judd e Tyler, que são pegos de surpresa, e Bobby, Claire (garota fã da Tiffany) e Gerald (Garoto fã da Tiffany), que gritaram pra caramba nas mortes deles), eles NEM GRITAM DE DOR. É MUITO RUIM! Eu não considero isso um filme de Rua do Medo. Pra mim é uma paródia MUITO mal feita de Pânico. Filme chato, irritante. Dá vontade de apagar todas as memórias. A protagonista não faz nada pra ser rainha do baile (que é o tema principal do filme). Tiffany parece só mais uma valentona do colégio (mesmo que ela seja, por trás ela é uma assassina!). É um filme que se desconecta da franquia Rua do Medo, e que parece ter medo de ser considerado Slasher.

The movie itself was great, but it does't go well with the universe. It just seems they did it to keep the franchise but it creates a lot of plotholes for the other movies. For example, in the first movie, we learn that the mall murders were the first one in 30 years, which doesn't work with the prom kills. And a lot of things like that. But it was still fun to watch
A follow up to a decent series of movies that presents nothing new or original.

Esta pelicula me recordo a lo que se veia en los 90, no habia sentido pero igual entretenia. La protagonista fue quien me llamo la atención por el desarrollo que tuvo a lo largo de la historia y pues ese final hace pensar que las cosas aun no terminan.
Creepy fun with that classic Fear Street vibe. It’s campy, bloody, and entertaining—exactly what you’d want from this series.

Didn't realize this would rate so low but yeah, very disappointed with this one. Besides a couple of kills that were pretty funny, the whole thing was just bad. The plot, some of the acting, the writing, just all not very good. There is 1 kill that was gory and actually was pretty good but that was about it. The whole story though was not great, disappointed after enjoying the original trilogy

Un slasher adolescente cumplidor, con una atmosfera ochentera muy bien lograda y varias escenas con efectos prácticos que se ven geniales. A nivel película creo que es de la peorcita de esta saga, se aleja mucho de la trilogía original y es mas un drama con algo de gore que terror.
Katherine Waterston is awesome but this horror spoof is predictable and a Scream rip off.

I'm not sure if this is even worth one star. It was blatantly bad. Not thought out, had no plot. Scattered, rushed shots that had no meaning to the actual film premise. Endlessly obnoxious gore because they couldn't think of anything else to show us. I found myself laughing many times.. not because of a funny joke, but because everything was just so random. It was like a child wrote the script.. The only reason I'm giving it one star is it at least had a good soundtrack. So my credit goes to 80s music being good. The score itself was ill used. Having this spooky techno score during prom dress shopping and family moments was just weird.. Genuinely everything about this movie is odd. You can guess who the killer is pretty much immediately. None of it was thought out. But it's at least bad entertainment, I'll give it that. Still, very disappointing given the first films in the franchise were actually solid.
Fear street prom queen does capture the 80s vibe but it is a generic slasher film and it breaks continuity with the trilogy as the killers are never mentioned.

I enjoyed the first three Fear Street films. This Fear Street Prom Queen is a terrible, painfully embarrassing combination of various slasher films and Netflix’s own Insatiable. It has virtually no connection to the previous trilogy apart from murders being in acted to teenagers, who are so unpleasant you wished the whole cast of characters would get slaughtered by the halfway mark so a new story could start.
